page.title: 08Gypsy travellers in Melling.
page.content: Every June a Fair is held at Appleby in Cumbria where, for 300 years, gypsies have been meeting and trading horses. Melling is on the gypsies' trade route to Appleby and at this time they come through the village regularly and stay en-route to and from the Fair. Some call in the Melling Hall Hotel for an evening drink and a chat. Some come from Bolton where,in winter,they live in houses. Many come in bow-topped wagons which are light for the horses to pull up hills. They tether their horses on the moor and stay here free of charge. One young gipsy stays in his tent in the village while his parents go on to the Fair. He works for local farmers, potato picking, siloing or odd jobbing, to earn money. He rides bareback through the village on a gypsy horse.
